author: Staff Reporter
text:
The 27{+t}{+h}road safety week observance in Coimbatore began with the distribution of awareness pamphlets to thousands of people.

They also got a handbook on road safety rules at the mega job fair organised by the government at Kovaipudur on Sunday.

Launch

Industries and Transport Minister P. Thangamani launched the drive in the presence of Minister for Rural Industries and Labour P. Mohan, Municipal Administration and Rural Development Minister S.P. Velumani and Joint Transport Commissioner P. Muruganandam.

Coimbatore Division of Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) also launched an awareness drive at the Gandhipuram Town Bus Stand on Sunday.

The corporation’s general manager A. Anbu Abraham flagged off a bus with images on accidents and road safety that will travel around the district till next Tuesday.

On Monday night, RTO officials conducted a special vehicle check at the Kaniyur Toll Plaza.

They also offered tea to weary drivers covering long distances and shared road safety tips with them. Reflective red tapes were affixed behind heavy vehicles for easy visibility.

Bull’s eye was fixed on head lamps to avoid blinding oncoming vehicle drivers.

The week-long awareness drive will go on till January 14, after which there will be a break for the Pongal holidays from January 15 to 17.

Events

It will resume on Monday and conclude on January 19. Various events have been planned for school students, drivers and public through awareness programmes.

Ooty

At Udhagamandalam, an exhibition on road safety was inaugurated at the Central Bus Stand by Regional Transport Officer T. Venkatraman. This was followed by a rally from the bus stand to the EB office, and back.
title: Road safety awareness week begins
